column2: We are Spartans. Centuries of Christianization have made us soft. Our heritage is swamped under the foreign monotheism of a dead Jew. Our gods are burnt and spit on./n NO MORE!! We are now in a position to ressurect the great state of Sparta, and the beauty of its warriors and martial prowess. As one united front, nothing can stop us. Let us cry together, as one united Spartan nation: THIS, IS, SPARTA!!!!
The primitive sons of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] live on borrowed time.
These men are not Roman, nor Greek. They will be put in their place.
THIS IS BLASPHEMY! THIS IS MADNESS!
These jumpstarts are no match for [Root.Culture.GetName] steel!

A new age has begun! The spirit of those patriots who stalled the Persians at Thermopylae remains in every Spartan heart! Our finest warriors stand at the ready to reestablish Sparta as a preeminent force on the earth! What can stop us? Who can stop us? THIS IS SPARTA!
Assemble the Sons of the Three Hundred

With the Spartan nation now in full force and ready to roll over the heathens, let us restore our ancient military drills and raise up an elite corps of Spartans, ready to fight and die for their nation. This is Sparta!
With the true Spartan nation once again in power, let us cast aside our decadent, Athenian and Constantinoplite ways and return to the true, battle-hardened glory of Sparta.

This Spartan character is a "Trembler", a craven and a coward. This makes him an anathema to every righteous Spartan alive, and is one of the only ways to lose Spartan citizenship. Until they can man up, this character has been excluded from Spartan society.

This Spartan infant was born with a phsyical or mental defect. Per Spartan custom, he or she is to be laid on a hill for dead to test his or her will to live. Should they survive or roll down the hill, they will be welcomed back to Spartan society with open arms, as one of the many artists and civilian administrators of the state.
This Spartan character is primed and ready for battle. He has come of age and has completed his war training.

By virtue of being born a Spartan and showing bravery in the will to live, this character has proven their worthiness to hold Spartan citizenship despite their inability to fight. They will instead provide auxillary tasks for the betterment of Spartan society, such as artistry, farming, teaching, and the like. As he or she does not have to focus on the rigors of Spartan training, he or she has directed his or her Spartan work ethic and drive elsewhere, to other skills.
